definition: The boundless vista is at the perilous peak (proverb)/fig. exhilaration follows a hard-won victory
pinyin: wu2 xian4 feng1 guang1 zai4 xian3 feng1

definition: (located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
(of a mountain) high and tapered peak or summit/mountain-like in appearance/highest level/classifier for camels

(last line of the poem 望岳 by Tang poet Du Fu 杜甫[Du4 Fu3]) with one look I shall see all the smaller mountains down below (from the summit of Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1])/(fig.) awe-inspiring view from a very high place
lit. until you reach the Great Wall, you're not a proper person; fig. to get over difficulties before reaching the goal
pinyin: bu4 dao4 Chang2 cheng2 fei1 hao3 han4

definition: to stand tall and see far (idiom); taking the long and broad view/acute foresight
lit. not to know the true face of Lushan Mountain/fig. can't see the forest for the trees
pinyin: bu4 shi4 Lu2 shan1 zhen1 mian4 mu4

definition: Jade Emperor Peak on Mt Tai in Shandong
to climb/to pull oneself up/to clamber/to scale/fig. to forge ahead in the face of hardships and danger
to climb over/to get over (difficulties)/to scale/to surmount
sheer cliffs and precipitous rock faces (idiom)
